title: Incunabula
content:
can you tell what sans this is on the album cover? sorry it's so small, it's the biggest one i could find. probably something so basic i'll be shamed? and how about throw me a bone guys, a trick for the aspiring identifier?   
(why do i feel like i'm going to be told many many hours and pairs of glasses..)   
   
 ![autechre](http://web.archive.org/web/20130831092813im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/7505.jpg)
author: aschmidt

comments.content: Hmm, its pretty small, but it seems like some kind of OCR ( B, maybe ) Font to me..

thnx, that was fast.   
   
what especially are monospaced types good for, besides programming?

Suddenly, out of nowhere David Hubner - with only 16 posts to his record - pulls a 4 minutes type ID! and is welcomed in the hallowed halls of the Typophile Type ID Hall of Fame.   
   
My hat's off to you, Mr. Hubner. Well, actually Stephen's hat. I haven't got any... ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130831092813im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Names on credit cards and [bills](http://web.archive.org/web/20130831092813/http:/www.orangeitalic.com/fonts/intmono.shtml)?   
   
Hmm, interesting question...
You can write a whole essay about monospaced types, Andrea. I'll get back to that later on.

Thank you, Mr. Peters..   
   
Oh, yess, the hallowed halls of the Typophile Type ID Hall of Fame.. Lovely..   
   
Thank you..
somtimes they (monospaced) give letters a more personal look, because of the typewriter association(?)........fRED
\>somtimes they give letters a more personal look, because of the \>typewriter association(?)........fRED
